column4: can anyone help me to find out shy some services aren't starting at boot (apache2 and mysql)?
Are the scripts to start them in the runlevel's directory?  (ie /etc/rc2.d/)
Is there anything in an error log that might be useful?
not sure which errorlog to look in...  both start correclty when run from the commandline bia /etc/init.d/xxx start
It may be that a dependency isn't being started far enough ahead of them.  I'd pop into /var/log and just grep for apache and msql
nothing obvious -- just the expected stuff -- and all looks like it's normal
Try renaming the init script to start later and see what happens?
no good -- still they both don't start --everythign else starts fine!
Try poking around with a tool like sysv-rc-conf, disabling and reenabling them

(or anyone else)  any other ideas where to look for this starting problem -- I've removed all the links, replaced them by hand and through sysv.-rc-conf.  This is unbelievable, it's as if they don't exist!
Are they missing some config files anywhere, or are any of those misconfigured?  (Prolly not since they start manually, but hey)
Do you have an odd disk setup so maybe something isn't mounted in time?
that's possible (it's actually a vpslink server) but I've placed them after _everything else_
is there perhaps somewhere I can put '/etc/init.d/apache2 start' so it gets run on startup -- just to see if that gets things started...
There's bootmisc.sh - you could put a 'sleep' timer in there to put it off further
